thread.title: A whale of a 24-hour marathon reading
thread.title_full: A whale of a 24-hour marathon reading

title: A whale of a 24-hour marathon reading
text: A whale of a 24-hour marathon reading Tuesday, 20 October 2015 (8 minutes ago) [...] begins one of the greatest American novels, “Moby-Dick,” Herman Melville’s symbol-heavy morality tale of obsession and insanity. Most Americans read the novel at some point in their lives, usually too young to appreciate its genius. Annual marathon readings of the white whale of a book take place in Connecticut, New York City and the old whaling town of New Bedford, Mass. Among the organizations participating are Green Apple Books, the South End Rowing Club, 826 Valencia, UC Berkeley, Cal Maritime, Stanford and S.F. State.
